title: 12 Strings
content:
12 Strings is a father-son duo consisting of Scott Lytle and his son Brandon Lytle. They have cultivated a rich musical journey spanning 17 years, beginning with Scott imparting his guitar skills to Brandon at a young age.

Brandon draws inspiration from guitar legends Stevie Ray Vaughan, John Mayer and, Joe Bonamassa to hone his passion for the craft. Scott having learned guitar at a young age, embarked on his own musical journey influenced by the likes of Rik Emmett, Tommy Emmanuel, and Gordon Lightfoot.

Together, they traverse various musical landscapes like playing in cover bands, online recording with musicians and at the iconic Metal Works Studio in Mississauga.

Their YouTube channel stands as a testament to their creativity and passion, showcasing their unique interpretations of beloved tunes. With each collaboration and performance, 12 Strings continue to leave a lasting impression on all who have the privilege of hearing them play.

Visit the Wine Garden August 24th and August 25th between 2pm and 5pm to hear the captivating sounds of 12 Strings!

 

Concerts free with admission. Buy Now!

title: Abby Stewart
content:
Abby Stewart is a country/rock performer from Kingston, ON, and she is thrilled to be back performing at The Ex. She has been performing all her life and has graced big stages such as Boots and Hearts, Ottawa Bluesfest, and Havelock Country Jamboree. Additionally, she has opened for artists such as Dan + Shay, Hunter Hayes, Brett Kissel, Jess Moskaluke, and Dallas Smith. Abby released her EP “Firsts” in 2015, which included her radio release “I’m Still Faster” and her first music video, which has over 800,000 views.

In recent years, she has released CBC/Sirius XM 171 charting songs produced by multi-CCMA Award Winning producer Jeff Dalziel, including “Bless Your Heart,” “Waste The Weekend,” and “Love’s Gone,” with “Love’s Gone” being written by country superstar Kelsea Ballerini along with Nancy Peacock and Brad Ellis.

Her music is available on all streaming services, and all music videos can be found on The Abby Stewart Channel on YouTube.

Come see the talented Abby Stewart on August 26th from 8pm to 11pm at the CNE Country Stage!

title: Abraxas
content:
Abraxas has been coined as the ultimate Santana tribute band fronted by Mexican-born Javier Vazquez on guitar and vocals delivering a powerful performance. The band pays homage to Santana’s early albums covering hits like “Black Magic Woman”, and “Maria Maria”. They feature a powerful and colorful female 3-piece horn section and a fierce 3-piece percussion section, faithfully recreating the authenticity of Santana. Abraxas delivers a spectacular performance honoring the greatness of Carlos Santana, creating an unforgettable show for the audience.

Visit the Midway Stage August 20th from 8pm to 11pm to hear the Santana tribute band Abraxas!

title: Adam Cousins
content:
Adam Cousins grew up in Brussels, Ontario where he discovered his passion for small-town country music. His love for the craft led him to pursue a career in the music industry. He seamlessly blends classic and original tunes to create his own musical style that leaves audiences in awe. In 2022, Adam was recognized by the London Ontario’s Forest City Music Awards as “Country Artist of the Year” and his single “Young Again” received Music Video of the Year. His momentum didn’t stop there, he released two singles in 2022 which quickly became popular on the radio reaching top 30 on CBC Sirius XM. In 2023, Adam released “In The End” a heartbreak anthem and in early 2024 he released “That Kinda Girl”. He has been spending time in the studio with his production team to release some new singles in 2024.

Visit the Country Stage September 1st between 3pm and 6pm to hear the talented Adam Cousins.

title: After the Gold Rush
content:
After the Gold Rush is one of the most recognizable Neil Young tribute bands. The combination of deeply personal lyrics and wide range of instrumentation creates a distinctive and compelling performance. After The Gold Rush is fronted by Andrew Sansone performing as “The Loner” and the backing band members are all seasoned musicians from the Greater Toronto area, having played shows, various festivals, theatres, and night clubs.

title: Andy Penkow
content:
Andy is an Australian singer songwriter who is currently based in Toronto. He’s known for his smooth, powerful vocals and his country, blues, folk, americana, and contemporary style of music. Andy has released four studio albums to date, with his latest album “Shades On Me” peaking at No. 2 on the Australian ARIA Charts and No. 1 on the Australian Independent Records Charts.

Visit the Country Stage August 27th between 3pm and 6pm to hear the powerful vocals of Andy Penkow.

title: April Wine
content:
April Wine is a Canadian rock band formed in 1969. Originally based in Halifax, Nova Scotia, the band enjoyed international success in the 1970s and 1980s, releasing more than 20 albums since 1971, and selling over 20 million albums worldwide. April Wine’s extensive discography includes numerous gold and platinum selling albums featuring mega-hits like ‘Roller’, ‘I Like to Rock’, ‘You Could Have Been a Lady’ and others. Best known for their international top 40 hit ‘Just Between You and Me’, an iconic power ballad that made them the very first Canadian band on MTV, April Wine went on to release over twenty albums and have received 11 Juno Award nominations. In 2009, April Wine was inducted into the Canadian Music Industry Hall of Fame and were honored with a Lifetime Achievement Award for being part of Canadian Music History for 40 years, and in 2010 the band was inducted into the Canadian Music Hall of Fame. The band continues to tour throughout North America to this day.

Discover the timeless rock legacy of April Wine and catch them live at the CNE Bandshell on August 31st for one unforgettable night!

Bell CNE Bandshell shows start at 7:30pm. April Wine will begin performing at 8:30pm. For performer set times, please check out our Instagram daily.

title: Awake & Dreaming
content:
Awake & Dreaming is a Canadian indie and alternative trio from Waterloo, Ontario. Sasha Kristoff, Stefan Schneider, and Ryan Dugal, the multi-instrumentalists, and singer-songwriters behind the band, create original music filled with ethereal soundscapes, beautiful melodies, and introspective lyrics. Known for their versatility, the band’s catalog covers a wide range of musical genres, often adding their own flavor to classic songs. Beyond their musical talent, Stefan and Sasha bring a unique flair to their performances as skilled ballroom dancers, who might just incorporate some dancing into their live show. The trio’s performance will leave a lasting impression and should not be missed.

Come to the Casino Patio on August 21st and August 22nd from 1:30pm to 5:30pm to see the talented band Awake & Dreaming perform live onstage!

title: Aysanabee
content:
Aysanabee is a two-time JUNO award-winning Oji-Cree artist. With a swirling mix of indie, soul, electronic sounds, and pulse-quickening fingerpicking, his music on his 2023EP “Here and Now” and his 2022 debut album “Watin” are both hypnotic and melodious. Aysanabee made history in March 2024 as the first Indigenous artist to win the JUNO Awards for Alternative Album of the Year and the coveted Songwriter of the Year, for “Here and Now”. He is the first Indigenous artist to hit Number 1 on Mediabase Canada’s Alternative Rock chart and has also been short-listed for the 2023 Polaris Prize. Aysanabee has performed close to 300 unforgettable shows on major stages, festivals, and venues across Canada and globally.

Come watch Aysanabee, the groundbreaking Indigenous artist perform his anthems for the soul with his band at the Bell CNE Bandshell on August 27th!

Bell CNE Bandshell shows start at 7:30pm. For performer set times, please check out our Instagram daily.

title: Bad to the Bone
content:
Bad to the Bone is North America’s one and only tribute to George Thorogood. Formed in the summer of 1993 by Gator James, the band has been going strong ever since. They are currently celebrating 30 years of BAD.

Based out of Oshawa, ON, this band is the only authentic tribute to George Thorogood to date and continues to wow audiences everywhere. They’ve shared stages with many recording artists over the years, some several times over, such as April Wine, Kim Mitchell, David Wilcox, Georgia Satellites, and many others. The band has performed at every type of venue, from festivals, arenas, boat cruises, and rib fests to private corporate events.

Join the Goerge Thorogood tribute band, Bad to the Bone on August 30 from 8pm to 11pm at the Midway stage!

title: Bahamas
content:
Afie Jurvanen, best known by his stage name Bahamas, is a Canadian singer and guitarist popular for his serene and captivating indie folk music. As a self-taught guitarist, he worked his way to the top, collaborating with world renowned artists such as The Lumineers, Feist, and Jack Johnson. Bahamas biggest streaming track “Lost in the Light” exudes a calm, catchy feel and has racked up nearly 100 million plays. His most recent album, “Bootcut”, released in September 2023, was recorded in Nashville, Tennesse, and produced by Grammy-Nominated Robbie Lackritz. This album takes on a country theme and is an absolute knockout for fans. Notably, it features Jurvanen backed by guitar legend Vince Gill, pedal-steel maestro Russ Pahl, bassist Dave Roe, harmonica player Mickey Raphel, and bluegrass legend Sam Bush.

Mark your calendars for August 18th and head to the Bell CNE Bandshell to experience the smooth music of Bahamas!

Bell CNE Bandshell shows start at 7:30pm. For performer set times, please check out our Instagram daily.

title: Big Boi
content:
Atlanta indisputably set the pace for modern hip-hop. However, Big Boi set the pace for Atlanta, and by proxy, the culture at large. The diamond selling artist, rapper, songwriter, record producer, actor, philanthropist born, Antwan André Patton (stage name, Big Boi) is a legacy as the region’s foremost wordsmith, and funkiest gentleman. Big made history as the preeminent spitter of the Dungeon Family and one-half of OutKast. He made his proper introduction as a solo artist in 2010 and released his most recent album “Boomiverse” in 2017. The smash single “All Night” blew up with 40 million streams in a year and hit the Top 30 on the pop chart and Top 10 at Rhythmic.

Catch modern hip-hop icon Big Boi bring the energy on stage at the Bell CNE Bandshell on August 25th!

Bell CNE Bandshell shows start at 7:30pm. For performer set times, please check out our Instagram daily.

title: Big Wreck
content:
Fronted by Toronto singer, songwriter and guitarist, Ian Thornley, Big Wreck burst onto the scene with their debut album “In Loving Memory Of…,” including the hit singles, “That Song,” “Blown Wide Open” and “The Oaf.” Following a hiatus from 2002 to 2010, the band returned the following year with their number one single “Albatross” and platinum-selling album of the same name. Big Wreck has gone on to release a continuous flow of celebrated hit albums and songs while crossing North America with their unique brand of heavy-hitting live rock.

title: Born Ruffians
content:
Based in Toronto, and founded in Midland, Ontario in 2006, the extraordinary Born Ruffians are an extremely successful Juno-nominated indie rock band. Led by frontman Luke Lalonde and backed by bassist Mitch DeRosier, drummer Steve Hamelin, and keyboardist Maddy Wilde, their music gives feel good vibes and is hard not to sing along to. The band’s latest trilogy of albums “JUICE” (2020), “SQUEEZE” (2020), and “PULP” (2021) reached #11 and #10 respectively on the Alternative New Artist Billboard Chart in the USA. They have also released 8 full-length albums and 3 Eps on several high-end record labels and have toured internationally supporting other big musical artists such as Caribou, Franz Ferdinand, Hot Chip and the New Pornographers.

Visit the Bell CNE Bandshell on August 24th to see the Born Ruffians rock out on stage!

title: Boston Levi
content:
Boston Levi, a Canadian Ottawa-based band, mixes arena-ready rock with alt-country and pop. Members Mike McNamee, Ryan Williams, Mike Montgomery, and Claud Northey explore the human experience with a soaring sound and down-to-earth lyrics. Boston Levi’s latest single, “Pretty Little Heartbreak” is a banger of a rock song that immediately grabs your attention and tells the age-old story of heartbreak from a unique perspective. Since 2022, the group has shared stages with many other artists, including Blackberry Smoke, The Glorious Sons, The Trews, The Strumbellas, and Texas King. In summer 2023, Boston Levi had the honor of headlining the Ottawa Bluesfest Sirius XM Stage and their biggest accomplishment so far has been opening for The Glorious Sons at Slush Puppie Place in Kingston.

Experience the electrifying rock music of Boston Levi at the Bell CNE Bandshell on August 31st!

title: Bree Taylor
content:
Bree Taylor is a rising star in the country music scene, known for her distinctive blend of country and rock. Bree is not just making music; she’s forging a genre-defying path that’s all her own. She draws inspiration from country legend Carrie Underwood and rock icon Joan Jett. Her songs carry unmistakable spirit of country music, with the raw power of rock n’ roll. She is breaking down barriers and stereotypes with her debut album “Dauntless” and stands as a powerful testament of her spirit. “Dauntless” was nominated for Album of the Year 2023 by Mississauga Music and it gained recognition for its impact and connection with listeners. “Dauntless” garnered significant attention with over 116,000 views on the music video. It embodies the rebel country spirit, encourages listeners to be unapologetically themselves. Bree Taylor is a trail blazer in the world of music, and her songs will stand the testament of time.

Visit the Country Stage August 17th from 3pm to 6pm to hear undeniable talent of Bree Taylor.

title: Brian McAnoy
content:
Brian McAnoy is a musician who performs regularly throughout Toronto.

He studied Piano, Guitar and Voice at the Royal Conservatory of Toronto and St. Michael’s Choir School in Toronto and has toured extensively throughout North America. His latest release is entitled Disgustingly Delicious and is available the summer of 2024. These days he splits his time between Canada and Ireland.

title: Brittany Howard
content:
Brittany Howard, renowned as an American solo artist based in Nashville, Tennessee, possesses immense talent as both a singer and songwriter, delving into the intricate realms of jazz, funk, and soul music. Formerly known as the frontwoman of the rock band Alabama Shakes, Brittany has been rewarded with five Grammy wins and sixteen nominations. Following the massive acclaim of her 2019 solo album debut, “Jaime,” Brittany’s latest album, “What Now,” emerged from a deliberately free-flowing process, further embracing the unfettered creativity that has long defined her work. Like “Jaime”, “What Now” sees Brittany once again taking the helm as a producer and working closely with her longtime collaborator, engineer, co-producer, and co-mixer Shawn Everett. Brittany Howard’s music is a thrilling opus that pushes the boundaries of voice, sound, and soul to new extremes!

Immerse yourself in Brittany Howard’s groundbreaking music performance at Bell CNE Bandshell on August 17th!

Bell CNE Bandshell shows start at 7:30pm. For performer set times, please check out our Instagram daily.

title: Broadtree
content:
Broadtree is an award-winning country duo based in Toronto. They have been heavily influenced by their experiences on theatrical stage and have created a unique blend of stylized storytelling while incorporating the sounds of catchy pop country. Their 3 most recent singles have reached #1 in Canada on the Indie Country Countdown. Their most recent single, “Until You’re Erased” came out on May 24.

The duo offers carefully crafted harmonies and energetic performances every time they grace the stage. Broadtree is also involved with a lot of social justice movements on social media, engaging with their fans to speak out about mental illness, racial equality, LGBTQ+, and First Nations rights in Canada.

Visit the Country Stage August 20th from 3pm to 6pm to hear the country pop duo Broadtree!

title: Bubblegum Bikini
content:
Bubblegum Bikini is the party your friends are talking about, that hazy night you’re trying to remember, and all the fun you know you’re about to have. Cooking up elements of funk, soul, rock and pop with a hefty helping of sweat, this Toronto outfit has made a name for themselves by packing dance floors all over the city. The starting five consists of drummer Da-Rell Clifton, trombonist Ernesto Barahona, saxophonist/vocalist Evan Porter, bassist Jon “Alacran” Amador and guitarist/vocalist Mark Calderone. By holding down residencies at some of Toronto’s favourite venues, Bubblegum Bikini has built a following of positive fun-loving people looking for a good time.

Join Bubblegum Bikini on August 28 from 3 PM to 6 PM at the Midway Stage for a lively performance of modern and upbeat covers of your favorite tunes.

title: Carson Janik
content:
Carson Janik comes from the small town of Tecumseh, Ontario and has been perfecting his craft of performing and songwriting since he was 14. He has had his single be the “judges pick” on the top 100 in CBC 2020 Searchlight competition and was a finalist in the Unsigned Only International music competition. This exposure garnered the attention of music industry moguls Terry Sawchuk and Brian Hetherman of 49th entertainment label, who signed Carson due to his success. Carson released “Neon to Lean On” and received 1,000,000 streams while being featured on Spotify’s New Music Friday Country and Young Nashville playlists. His first radio single “Til’ A Heart Breaks You”, garnered over 20,000 streams in its first week and has received 2,000,000 views on TikTok.

title: Chandra Raye & The Get Down
content:
Chandra Raye (“Chach”), the Canadian singer, songwriter, and producer, has redefined the boundaries of soul, pop, and house music, in the ever-evolving landscape of modern music. Chach not only performs her own music, but she also collaborates with other bands such as Sensation Live, The Flashback Experiment, and her own Band, The Get Down. With powerhouse vocals and the ability to sing everything from Soul, R&B, Rock, Dance, and Top 40, she has quickly become a highly sought-after singer and performer both in her hometown and abroad. Chach has collaborated with some of the world’s top house music DJs such as Jason B, Hi Definition, Ron Allen, Tricky Moreira, Dino and Terry, and Snow. With the support of renowned DJs on a global scale, she has secured her place in the pantheon of modern dance music.

Attend the Casino Patio on August 17th from 1:30pm to 5:30 pm to be entertained by Chandra Raye & The Get Down!

title: Classic Albums Live Performs Bob Marley’s Legend
content:
Classic Albums Live (CAL) takes the greatest albums and recreates them live on stage – note for note, cut for cut. These albums are historic and stand the test of time and CAL honors these records and their fans by delivering performances that sound exactly like these records. To do this, CAL boasts an exceptional ensemble of performers, all of whom have graced music’s elite stages and collaborated with industry icons. Each CAL show offers two distinct experiences: a faithful rendition of the chosen record in the first half, followed by a dynamic set featuring the artist’s greatest hits. As fans ourselves, we aim to exceed expectations and deliver an unforgettable experience. It is this unwavering passion and dedication to authenticity that defines the very soul of CAL and resonates deeply with audiences.

Join us at the Bell CNC Bandshell on August 22nd to experience Classic Albums Live recreate Bob Marley’s quintessential “Legend” album live on stage!

Bell CNE Bandshell shows start at 7:30pm. For performer set times, please check out our Instagram daily.

title: Coalition 6ix
content:
Coalition 6ix is a Toronto-based band blending reggae, funk, hip-hop, and soul, founded by childhood friends Dale Greenridge and David Sicard. Dale, also known as ‘Swanny’, is a versatile singer, songwriter, and instrumentalist whose prolific songwriting is central to the band’s sound. He has collaborated with various artists, including the hip-hop duo Point Blank with David Sicard. David brings funk-infused energy and a unique vocal style influenced by legends like James Brown and Prince.

Cassondra Marie adds soulful vocals and songwriting skills, working closely with Dale and David to craft memorable songs. Ryan Chasmer, or ‘Chas’, transitioned from drumming to bass guitar, contributing melodic bass lines and energetic dance moves. Younger members Allen Kraskovsky and Jean-Francois Merrimen, known as ‘Pitou’, bring a youthful energy into the band. Allen, a self-taught guitarist, brings creative songwriting and diverse musical influences, while Pitou’s contributions further enhance the band’s vibrant and dynamic sound. Together, Coalition 6ix offers a vibrant, nostalgic, yet fresh musical experience that you won’t want to miss!

Find the unique sounds of Coalition 6ix on August 24 to 25 at 8pm to 11pm or on August 31 from 3pm to 6pm at the Bach Bar Stage!

 

Concerts free with admission. Buy Now!

title: Coty Robinson
content:
A big man with a big voice, Coty Robinson is aiming to be a household name. With the loss of his mother at a young age, Robinson dived headfirst into music to cope with the pain and heartbreak. For Coty, connecting with music was a way to express his own experiences, struggles, and emotions and to honor his mother’s memory. Johnny Cash, Eric Church, Lee Brice, and Luke Combs have all influenced Coty’s songwriting. When he was unable to find the words to say, a song always could.

His single “Bigger Guy” released in 2022, has over 600,000 streams and has resonated with fans globally. Coty lives to perform, captivating audiences at events like Manitoulin CountryFest, Kipawa CountryFest, Canadian National Exhibition, Sauble Beach Party, Stevensville Ram Rodeo, Hamilton Tiger Cats Season Opener, and more. His live shows are known for their electrifying energy and heartfelt connections. Recently signed with Honky Tonk Records, Coty’s debut label single “Diggin’ (on You)” was co-written with Daryl Scott and Jesse Slack and produced by CMAO-nominated Adam Newcomb. With big dreams and a big voice, Coty Robinson continues to make his mark in country music.

Experience Coty Robinson’s remarkable stage presence on August 23rd from 3pm to 6pm at the country stage.

 

Concerts free with admission. Buy Now!

title: Cousin Harley
content:
Cousin Harley, from their first EP in a makeshift studio to playing alongside legends like Jeff Beck, have come a long way over nearly two decades. They’ve rocked stages from Las Vegas to Byron Bay, blending Basie band swing, and Appalachian soul. Collaborating with icons like Bill Kirchen and Brian Setzer, their genre-defying sound revitalizes mid-century American music, from Gypsy Jazz to shredding rock. With a cult-like following and global acclaim, they’re hailed as virtuosos in their field. Cousin Harley is not to be trifled with and not to be missed!

Come visit the Casino Patio on August 28th and August 29th from 7pm to 11pm to experience the genre-defying music of Cousin Harley!

title: CRUSH: The Ultimate Rush Experience
content:
CRUSH: The Ultimate Rush Experience is a 3-piece Rush Tribute Act hailing from Toronto, Canada, featuring members of Pyramid Theorem. Their passion for Rush, paired with expert musicianship, distinguishes them as one of Canada’s premier Rush Tribute Acts. If you’re seeking a set that spans decades and includes all of Rush’s classic hits along with some truly obscure deep cuts, look no further – CRUSH has you covered!

Jam out to classic Rush favourites with CRUSH: The Ultimate Rush Experience on August 28 from 8pm to 11pm at the Midway Stage!

title: Dan Box
content:
Based in the Niagara Region, Dan Box is a talented multi-instrumentalist and singer whose music can be best described as a blend of rock ‘n roll, blues, and folk. He has been performing live across the Niagara Region and surrounding GTA since age 15. Performing hundreds of shows acoustically and as part of his electric three piece, Hey McFly. Music has always been his driving force and one of the main components in his life. Specializing in classic rock covers ranging from The Beatles to Tom Petty, Neil Young to Peter Gabriel and more. Dan has recently released his first original EP with his original band, Aeronaut. He brings a soulfulness and passion to each performance that brings each song to the forefront. Armed with only an acoustic guitar and a microphone, Dan puts his performance first.

Visit the Wine Garden August 24 to August 26 from 6pm to 9pm to hear the soulful tunes of Dan Box.

title: Danny Marks
content:
Toronto’s own Danny Marks is a multi-talented, multi-tasking music man who has lived many lives in his four decades as a guitarist, songwriter, and media personality. A long-time radio and television host, he is a recipient of the Toronto Blues Society’s Blues with a Feeling Award for lifetime achievement in music and broadcasting. A leading light on the Toronto music scene, Danny’s musical roots go back to the sixties as a founding member of Edward Bear. He has opened for and backed up artists as diverse as Led Zeppelin, Bo Diddley, Paul Butterfield, Stephen Stills, Humble Pie, Ronnie Hawkins, Rick James, Tiny Tim, and many more. In 2013, Marks began another new enterprise as the host of Cities in Blue on BBC First TV. Danny’s ongoing radio show BLUZ FM is currently heard every Saturday night on JAZZ FM91. He continues to headline at festivals and clubs all over Southern Ontario.

P.S.: Danny was the first vocalist on the CNE jingle “Let’s Go To The EX.”

Visit the legendary talent, Danny Marks on August 22nd between 8pm and 11pm at the Beach Bar Stage!

title: dee holt
content:
Montreal-based artist, dee holt brings a new offering to alt-pop music with her soft, charming, and wistful voice. Her debut single, “Hardest Part” and “Olivia”, earned her on spot on Spotify’s LOREM playlist, among countless others, and the momentum has not stopped. In 2022, dee released her debut EP, “When I Close My Eyes”, receiving millions of streams, playlist covers, strong reviews, and a Spotify billboard in downtown Toronto. Dee capped off the year with a momentous debut performance at M for Montreal, winning praise from Canadian press such as La Presse, La Journal de Montreal, Cult MTL, RANGE, and more. Dee is rising to stardom as her brand-new single is currently climbing the charts, and her new EP is set for release.

Visit the Bell CNE Bandshell on August 21st to experience the amazing vocals of dee holt!

title: Destra and The Bakanal Band
content:
Destra Garcia, from Trinidad and Tobago, has forged a remarkable career in music since her debut in 1999. Known as Destra, she has become a trailblazer as the first female band owner and leader in Caribbean music. Her energetic live performances and vibrant costumes have made her a standout at global festivals and alongside international stars such as Rihanna and Beyonce. Destra has released fifteen albums since her debut, earning accolades such as 15 Soca Awards and recognition at the IRAWMA and Black Canadian Awards. Her recent hit single “Shake the Place,” featuring Machel Montano and remixed by Nicki Minaj, underscored her ongoing relevance and versatility in the music industry. Despite her success, Destra remains grounded, emphasizing humility and a commitment to her craft as she continues to evolve her brand globally.

Experience Destra live at the Bell CNE Bandshell on August 29th, celebrating her vibrant Caribbean music.

Bell CNE Bandshell shows start at 7:30pm. Destra and The Bakanal Band will begin performing at 8:30pm. For performer set times, please check out our Instagram daily.

Concerts free with admission. Buy Now!

title: DNGOLÉ
content:
DNGOLÉ (pronounced DING-GO-LAY) is a small combo of music and fun-loving friends—Gerry Williams, Suzy Lewis, Mickey Maharaj, and Michelle Walker—each boasting a wealth of performing experience on stages, in studios, living rooms, patios—wherever the music takes them.

Based in the Greater Toronto Area, with origins in Trinidad and Tobago, their repertoire reflects the multicultural, multi-ethnic heritage of their twin-island nation. Their influences come from every part of the world, and they are always ready to embrace new music genres. Yet, they always retain the warmth of the islands that Caribbean folk are extremely proud of. You can feel it in the tone of their voices, in the sway of their bodies, and in the warm melodies and harmonies they create. As proud nationals of Trinidad and Tobago, they strive to feature the steelpan in all of their appearances.

Catch the unique sounds of DNGOLÉ on the Beach Bar Stage, August 25 from 3pm to 6pm!

title: Doriann Forrester Trio
content:
Doriann Forrester is a renowned  Canadian flutist and singer. She is known for her distinctive sound, musicality, and varied repertoire.  Forrester’s music has been featured on television and film, and she has performed in musicals, orchestras, a Juno nominated band and in wind and jazz ensembles.

Come listen to the Jazz Vocals, Flute and Bass Flute sounds of Doriann Forrester accompanied by Phil Disera (Guitar) & Jordan O’Connor (Bass) at the CNE Wine Garden August 16 and 17, 2pm to 5pm.

title: Down with Webster
content:
Since their debut performance at a junior high talent show, Down with Webster has been creating their own style of genre-bending sounds and has blown away audiences ever since. Their tracks have dominated Top40 Radio charts, with millions of singles sold and streams tallying in the hundreds of millions. They’ve done electrifying performances at the MMVA’s, Junos, and festivals across the country. The band’s tireless pursuit of creating the greatest party on stage has won them a rabid fanbase coast to coast. title: Dr. Jay & Friends
content:
When it comes to Canada’s Caribbean music scene, Dr. Jay is considered Soca royalty. With his vast musical talents and ongoing recognition for his experience in building Soca’s nightlife culture over the past three decades of his career, ‘De Soca Prince’ is undisputed as the nation’s #1 Soca DJ. For ten years, he hosted and produced ‘Soca Therapy’ on FLOW 93.5, one of the top-rated weekly shows on the commercial FM dial. Dr. Jay’s skills have taken the sweet sounds of the Caribbean worldwide, from Hong Kong to Australia to Dubai to Berlin Germany, London England and back to the islands of the Caribbean as well as across North America. He has worked with some of Soca music’s biggest stars. Legends such as Machel Montano, Destra, Kes The Band and Rupee, and has also produced hit records for Skinny Fabulous, Edwin Yearwood and Lil’ Bitts, to name a few.

Come see the 2x International Soca DJ of the Year live on August 29th at the Bell CNE Bandshell!

The band consists of Kevin Harvey on vocals, guitarist Rob MacDonlad, bassist Carl Rufh, drummer Rob Couture and Mark LecLerc on the saxophone. Each of whom write and arrange material, bringing a unique sound to the overall mix. The result is blues, folk, soul, gospel, and R&B woven into a contemporary sound. title: Emily Schultz
content:
Recognized by David Foster as a world class, up-and-coming talent, Emily Schultz has injected herself into the Canadian music scene with force and grace. A FACTOR-funded artist with over 200 live performances in the last year, Emily’s powerful artistry, dynamic voice and honest stage presence has solidified her as a seasoned performer across Canada (Mariposa Folk Festival, Hops & Harvest Festival, Edmonton Folk Music Festival) with features on eTalk, Much Music and Breakfast TV. Recognized for her mastery and universality as a songwriter, Emily’s release ‘What Do I Know’ off her debut EP ‘Family Name’ earned a nomination for Song of the Year for the Ontario Folk Music Awards, with writing credits across DSPs summing to 2million streams and counting. Emily blends genres seamlessly, from folk to R&B to pop to country, all passionately used to give the listener a diverse experience, from dancing in their seats to holding their loved ones in reflection. Using all her skills towards connection, art and community, Emily has cemented herself as a huge up-and-coming Canadian talent to be watched.

title: Epic Eagles
content:
Epic Eagles is North America’s top Eagles and Don Henley tribute act, celebrated for their renditions of classic hits and deep cuts. Known for their rock ‘n’ roll energy and attention to detail, Epic Eagles delivers high-energy shows that capture the Eagles’ iconic sound.

Led by Dean Young, who channels Don Henley’s style, and multi-instrumentalist Mike Alonzo, who covers roles from Glenn Frey to Joe Walsh, the band is renowned for its musical precision and vocal harmony. Joined by Jeff Salem on drums, Dan Bohemier on bass and keys, and other talented musicians, they recreate the Eagles’ timeless music with passion.

Audiences enjoy Eagles classics like “Hotel California,” “One of These Nights,” and “Life in the Fast Lane,” along with deeper cuts cherished by fans. Epic Eagles’ performances, with their authentic sound and dynamic presence, make them stand out among tribute acts.

Eric Jackson & The Willow River Band are an alternative-country folk group who’s journey began in 2021 when Métis singer-songwriter, Eric Jackson, assembled a group of like-minded musicians who are deeply passionate about storytelling. Their vision for the band was to blend country, folk, and alternative rock to create a sound all their own.

The band’s name originates from the Grand River in Waterloo, where the band lives and continues to record. Since the bands inception they have had 3 singles on SiriusXM including “Birds of Prey” which reached #14 on the Indigenous Music Countdown. While their debut single “Two Churches & a Bar” reached #7 on the Canadian Indie Country Countdown. Eric Jackson & The Willow River Band continue to captivate audiences across Ontario with their unique sounds.

title: Farmer Nappy
content:
Darryl “Farmer Nappy” Henry is a Trinidadian soca star with over 30 years in the industry, celebrated for hits like “Big People Party” and “Chippin'”. Rising from Xtatik, he became renowned for his groovy soca style, winning accolades such as MTV Iggy’s Artist of the Week in 2012. Farmer Nappy’s albums “You Make Me…Surrender” and “House of Soca” garnered international acclaim, showcasing his signature sound. Throughout his career, Farmer Nappy toured globally and performed alongside stars like Rick Ross and Ja Rule. He delivered hits, including the 2019 smash “Hookin’ Meh”. In 2021, his track “Backyard Jam” became a soca anthem, earning him the Soca Monarch and Road March titles. Farmer Nappy’s enduring influence as a soca artist has made him a beloved figure in Trinidad, the Caribbean, and beyond, embodying the genre’s spirit while staying rooted in its traditions.

Come experience Farmer Nappy’s groovy soca style on August 29th at the Bell CNE Bandshell!

Fiddlestix has been a driving force in the Canadian music scene for nearly 15 years. Known for their explosive blend of Country, Celtic, and Folk Rock, Fiddlestix has established themselves as a symbol of musical excellence, captivating audiences across Ontario and Internationally. Their dynamic performances have graced festivals worldwide, from playing for the Olympic Torch arrival in Toronto with Gord Downie (Tragically Hip) to Phuket Kings Cup Regatta in Thailand. They have participated in events all around the world, including Singapore and most recently Norway. Fiddlestix’s impressive repertoire of music has granted them the opportunity to play 35-show runs at the CNE in 2022 and for the East Coast Kitchen Party stage. In 2023, they performed at Hagersville Rocks and for the Spirit of Edmonton Grey Cup celebrations in Hamilton. Most recently their single “Apple Moonshine” has resonated nationally and gained them a spot on Canada’s Top 50 Country Radio Stations.

title: Ghostly Kisses
content:
Ghostly Kisses is the musical project of French-Canadian singers Margaux Sauvé and Louis-Étienne Santais. The duo explores the allure of secrets and intimacy with their latest electronic pop album, “Darkroom” . Through their ‘Box of Secrets’ initiative on their website, they collected anonymous stories from fans worldwide, using them to create meaningful, impactful music. Darkroom explores themes of loneliness and reinvention, by collaborations with George FitzGerald and Oli Bayston. Ghostly Kisses offer an awe-inspiring hope for connection, for love, even when it seems impossible. By opening their music to be the conduit for other people’s stories, they landed up finding their own, prompting that same hope around the world.

title: James Anthoney
content:
James Anthony’s musical journey began at age 10, and by 15, he was performing at Ontario Place. Turning professional at 17, he followed in the footsteps of legendary musicians. He got his first guitar, a Harmony Archtop, from his father’s poker game win and used it to develop his skills and launch his career. From performing at his grade 7 dance to jamming with Rick James on Yonge Street, James has a rich musical history.

James has explored many musical styles, from blues, folk, and soul to bluegrass and reggae. In the ’80s, he shifted to country music, supporting Canadian artists and appearing on CFGM’s Opry North Radio Show. After settling in Cambridge, he joined Lulu’s Kats band, released CDs, and hosted “The Midnight Hour” TV show. His talents were recognized in 2013 with induction into the international Blues Hall of Fame. Today, James continues to perform at summer festivals, casinos, and clubs, bringing his rich musical experience to every stage.

Visit the Beach Bar stage on August 26 between 7 PM and 10 PM or on August 30 between 3 PM and 6 PM to experience the many musical styles of Kenny V!

title: Listen to the Music
content:
The Doobie Brothers are one of the most iconic Classic Rock bands of all time, having sold millions of albums and topping the charts with great hit songs such as China Grove, Long Train Running, What a Fool Believes, Black Water and, of course, Listen to the Music. After five decades, their music is still in heavy rotation on Classic Rock radio stations worldwide. LISTEN TO THE MUSIC BAND is a tribute to the Doobie Brothers consisting of some of the best musicians and singers in Canada. These highly skilled musicians meticulously reproduce each and every great hit song live to give audiences a true experience of seeing and hearing the Doobie Brothers Band perform live. You will want to see this amazing show over and over again.

Check out the Doobie Brothers Tribute Band, Listen to the Music, on August 24 from 8pm to 11pm at the Midway stage!

The Lost Patients are a prestigious cover band who have been a staple on the Toronto music scene since their inception in 2014. The band is comprised of Rich Roxborough, John Omand, Chris Whelehan and Paul Maddigan. Together they pride themselves on creating a vibrant atmosphere while putting a unique spin on fan favorite hits.

Visit the Casino Patio on August 20th, August 26th and August 27th from 7pm to 11pm to hear the vibrant band Lost Patients rock out on stage!

title: Lou Moore and Friends
content:
Lou Moore has over 50 years of experience playing various engagements. He was a member of the Good Brothers Band for close to 5 years in the 80s and toured around Europe with them just before the pandemic. Lou Moore also played alongside the Tommy Hunter touring band for a short time. He has played hundreds of local places with a genre that focuses on old time rock ‘n roll, country rock, traditional country, and blues and bluegrass music.

title: Mackenzie Leigh Meyer
content:
Mackenzie Leigh Meyer is a unique country musician who has incredible vocal stylings, reflecting her country, roots and pop influences. Her authentic lyrics and strong stage presence captivate audiences alike. She’s an up-and-coming country star who’s a force to be reckoned with.

In 2018, she debuted her EP “Dive Bar Diva”, which landed her a spot on stages all over Canada including Boots & Hearts, Lucknow’s Music in the Fields, Shania Twain’s “Queen of Me” tour amongst others. Her music has received several accolades including being featured on Spotify’s “Radar Canada” and Amazon’s “Top Canadian Country of 2022”. She was crowned the CMA Ontario Roots Artist of the Year in both 2023 and 2024. Most recently she has released her sophomore EP “Bar Star” which is soon to be a country music hit.

Visit the Country Stage August 29th from 8pm to 11pm to hear the vocal stylings of Mackenzie Leigh Meyer!

title: MacKenzie Porter
content:
Rising to international acclaim with a distinct country-pop shimmer, Canada-born, Nashville-based rising star MacKenzie Porter‘s sound knows no borders. Making a statement with her just-released, 19-track Big Loud Records debut, “Nobody’s Born With A Broken Heart”, Porter shines across the project EUPHORIA. Magazine praises as having “a song on it for everyone.” The sparkling talent has made high-profile global appearances on The Kelly Clarkson Show, Good Morning America, Jimmy Kimmel Live!, CBC q, The Morning Show, and many more, and will co-host the 2024 CCMAs alongside Thomas Rhett this fall. Porter broke out in 2022 with chart-dominating, six-week U.S. No. 1 “Thinking ‘Bout You” with duet partner Dustin Lynch, building on international success as the first female this century to have six No. 1 songs at Canadian country radio and adding to over 920 million global on-demand streams. Touring the globe opening for Blake Shelton, Kenny Chesney, Walker Hayes, Jordan Davis, Brad Paisley, Dallas Smith, Rascal Flatts, and more, MacKenzie wrapped her own Canadian headline tour earlier this year, and will open for Parker McCollum, Keith Urban, and Brett Young this summer.

Do not miss the chance to see global country popstar MacKenzie Porter at the Bell CNE Bandshell on August 19th!

Bell CNE Bandshell shows start at 7:30pm. For performer set times, please check out our Instagram daily.

title: Manchester Orchestra
content:
Since their formation in Atlanta, Georgia, Manchester Orchestra has become synonymous with indie rock excellence. The band includes singer, songwriter and rhythm guitarist Andy Hull, lead guitarist Robert McDowell, bassist Andy Prince and drummer Tim Very. Manchester Orchestra has released six studio albums to date including critically acclaimed “The Million Masks of God (2021)” and the introspective “The Valley of Vision (2023)”. With each release, Manchester Orchestra delves deeper into themes of adulthood, faith, and redemption, captivating listeners with their evocative storytelling and emotive performances. Known for their electrifying live shows, Manchester Orchestra has graced the stages of some of the world’s most prestigious music festivals such as Lollapalooza, Bonnaroo, Coachella, Riot Fest, Shaky Knees Music Festival, Firefly Music Festival, Reading and Leeds Festivals, and Austin City Limits Music Festival.

Get ready to rock out at the Bell CNE Bandshell on August 23rd with Manchester Orchestra!

Bell CNE Bandshell shows start at 7:30pm. For performer set times, please check out our Instagram daily.

title: Marshall Dane
content:
Marshall Dane is a natural born storyteller whose artist journey has been shaped by a life full of victories and setbacks. These experiences have made Marshall a unique artist, not chasing validation from industry standards and music streams. He was born into a family of musicians, being the son of a preacher shaped his musical transformation and created a soulful depth rarely seen in other musicians. His love for music is shown through his expression of vulnerabilities, emotion and confessional style of delivering lyrics, which resonate deeply with his listeners. Marshall’s passion for performance shines through when he’s on stage, whether he is playing for small intimate audiences or large stadiums of people. He has a strong sense of compassion and inclusivity which is apparent in his use of American Sign Language. By incorporating ASL into his performances, he not only makes it accessible for the Deaf but he also brings awareness to the community. Marshall success has garnered him five nominations for Male Artist of the Year at the Country Music Association of Ontario Awards. He has also performed at renowned music festivals like Boots & Hearts, Sarnia Bayfest, The CNE, and the Calgary Stampede. His unique blend of country and rock makes his music universally appealing and transcends borders.

Visit the Country Stage August 31st between 8pm and 12am to hear the talented Marshall Dane.

title: Matt Morson
content:
Matt Morson is a songwriter and performer. His music is infused with southern rock, country, and blues influences. Morson’s charismatic presence and ability to connect with audience is what’s led him to several notable performances. With over 1M combined Spotify streams, his music captures the true story telling element of his passion. Highlights include opening for Doc Walker, George Canyon, Jojo Mason, River Town Saints, Paul Brandt and Aaron Pritchett to name a few. His current single “By the River” stems from a southern country blues atmosphere with a memorable pulse beat that remains memorable. Most comfortable on stage, he and his band are known for a high energy and extremely passionate live shows.

Visit the Matt Morson at the CNE Country Stage on August 22nd from 8pm to 11pm

content:
Formed in 1977 by lead vocalist Michael White, The White – Led Zeppelin Tribute Band have performed more than 6000 shows to over 1 million people worldwide. Endorsed by Robert Plant and Jimmy Page, The White were the world’s first Led Zeppelin tribute band. Don’t miss the show!

Experience the thrills of a Led Zeppelin concert with Michael and The White – Led Zeppelin Tribute, on August 26 from 8:00pm to 11:00pm at the Midway Stage!

title: Midnight Destiny Band
content:
Midnight Destiny Band is an acoustic duo formed in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The band is comprised of Kevin Blake and Chris James, who write many of their own songs, and perform covers by various artists whom they admire. Most of their covers are popular music from the late 90s and early 2000s in varied genres such as soft rock, pop, hard rock, and country.

title: Mike Chianelli
content:
Mike Chianelli is a Neo-Traditional Country Singer/Songwriter from Georgina, Ontario, with a singular goal: to make every word and note genuine, true to himself, and full of soul. He blends his love for classic country music with lyrics inspired by his heroes, loved ones, memorable nights out, and his experiences working in the trades.

When Mike isn’t pursuing his musical dreams in bars, concert halls, and festivals, he’s working on the vehicles that take him to his next show. His storytelling brings to life the tales of family, old friends, and local legends, promising to keep their history alive. Mike and his band, “The Lost Truck Drivers,” are dedicated to preserving the roots of real Country, old school Blues, and Rock-A-Billy in their music.

Straight shooting, good timing country music with nothing to hide and only truth to tell are Mike’s passion and where his heart lives!

Experience Mike Chianelli’s Musical Storytelling on August 27th between 8pm and 11pm at the CNE Country Stage!

title: Mo Guzman

Mo Guzman is a self-taught singer, guitarist and percussionist who began his career in 2015 busking on the streets of downtown Toronto. His gift of raw vulnerability transcends his audience in a heartfelt experience, catering to a variety of different occasions. Mo is known for connecting with and engaging diverse crowds of all ages, cultures, and backgrounds. His unique vocal style encompasses a broad range of music, with an inter-generational repertoire ranging from the 1960’s to modern day, including rock, R&B, soul, pop, country and more.

Visit the Casino Patio on August 19th, and August 20th from 1:30pm to 5:30pm to hear the unique vocal stylings of Mo Guzman!

title: Moneen
content:
Moneen, a Canadian post-hardcore band that emerged in the early 2000s, creates irresistibly catchy and unique alternative music. From Brampton, Ontario, the band is comprised of original members – Kenny Bridges, Chris Hughes, Peter Krpan, and Erik Hughes. Moneen stands out because of their intense and relatable lyrics and exceptional soundscapes. They have released several hit albums including their first debut “The Theory of Harmonial Value” in 2001. They have also toured throughout North America and Europe, sharing stages with famous artists such as Dashboard Confessional, Thrice, and Taking Back Sunday. Moneen has had a massively positive impact on the world of alternative music, inspiring a new generation of musicians to continue exploring innovative sounds.

Catch Moneen live at the Bell CNE Bandshell on August 23rd and experience their headbanging hits!

content:
Toronto’s Monkey Wrench is a high-energy rock band delivering all your favorite Foo Fighters songs and other alternative hard rock hits. The band consists of longtime Toronto scene members Joe De Lima on guitar and vocals, Neil Morrison on drums, Peter Cardillo on lead guitar, JD Defino on lead guitar, and JD the Machine on bass. Their motto is “everything harder, faster, and louder!”

In 2019, Monkey Wrench started gaining attention from festival organizers and were included in events such as Q107’s Canada Day Bash at Woodbine Park, Bradford’s Carrot Fest, Aurora Rib Fest, and the Australia Benefit Concert at Oshawa Music Hall, just to name a few. Monkey Wrench – The Best of the Foo Fighters – always put on incredible, high-energy shows when they hit the stage!

title: Mudmen
content:
Mudmen, initially known as “The Campbell Brothers,” are a high-energy Celtic band with a unique flair. Reestablished in 1998, they have performed over 3,000 shows across eight countries and released 11 studio albums. Their music has been featured in Xbox and PlayStation games, NBC’s “The Black Donnellys,” WWE Wrestling, HBO’s “Shameless,” and multiple editions of Don Cherry’s Rock’ em Sock’ em hockey videos. Notably, they performed for the Queen of England on Canada Day and have appeared at major events like the Oilers/Flames home opening ceremony, 12 Canada’s Walk of Fame ceremonies, and the IIHF World Hockey Tournament. Mudmen have shared stages with renowned acts such as ZZ Top, The Guess Who, and Johnny Reid. Celebrating 26 years in 2024, the band continues to captivate audiences of all ages with their fun and engaging performances.

Visit the Country Stage on September 2nd from 3pm to 6pm to hear the Mudmen play their Celtic tunes!

Get ready to experience Music Machine Live. These talented musicians seamlessly blend music genres from one song to the next. With Nina Cutrone on vocals, Piero Greco on bass, JT on guitar, Joe Polito on guitar and Joe Delmedico on drums, each member brings their own unique flavour to the mix. title: Nate Haller
content:
Since his debut as a solo artist, Nate Haller has firmly established himself as one of Canadian country’s premier talents, bringing his unmatched vocals and energetic live performances to some of the biggest stages across the nation. Nate took his rightful spot at center stage with his first single “Lightning In A Bottle”, which earned him his first Top 10 at Canadian radio. With over 18.9M global streams, Nate has already landed numerous accolades, and major festival appearances. Nate’s newest single “Drive” will be on the radio this summer and fans can expect performances at major country festivals like Boots & Hearts and Lucknow’s Music in the Fields as well as the release of brand-new music.

Catch Canadian country sensation Nate Haller live at the Bell CNE Bandshell on August 19th!

title: Nicholas Campbell
content:
From slick hot-rod rockabilly to smooth crooning honky tonk, Nicholas Campbell is the real deal. Inspired by iconic country sounds, from Faron Young to Brian Setzer, Campbell picked up the guitar at age 10 and was gigging by 11. During the pandemic, Nicholas began playing consistently with his band, The Two Meter Cheaters, and they quickly found their groove as live shows resumed.

In 2021, the band released Campbell’s debut album, “Livin’ and Other Western Ideas,” blending rockabilly, western swing, and honky tonk. The album received worldwide coverage and airplay from Western Canada to Spain, Italy, and more. As live music blossomed again, Nicholas shared the stage with talented artists like Melissa Payne, Paul Reddick, and Blue Rodeo, and won the 2023 Peterborough Folk Festival Emerging Artist Award.

With new singles and the upcoming album “Gonna Have a Ball Tonight,” the group has shifted to a more rock ‘n’ roll-centric sound, adding renewed energy to Campbell’s signature country style.

Visit the CNE Country stage on August 31st from 3pm to 6pm to hear the invigorating Nicholas Campbell.

title: Nicole Rayy
content:
Nicole Rayy is making her mark in country music, with over 45K social followers and 4.5 million streams, including 700K for her hit single “Feels Like Yesterday.” An eight-time CMA Ontario nominee and 2024 Music Video of the Year winner, she’s been recognized by The Boot, Complete Country, and Top Country. Her music has appeared on playlists like Spotify’s New Music Nashville and Amazon Music’s Breakthrough Country.

Nicole has performed at festivals like Hagersville Rocks, Dauphin’s Countryfest and Manitoulin Country Fest, and she’s played the World Music Festival in Shanghai for four consecutive years. Additionally, she’s a strong supporter of female artists, creating initiatives like the #AllWomanMusic songwriter series and the all-female festival HarmoniaFest, now in its fifth year.

Catch rising talent Nicole Rayy at the Country Stage on August 25 between 3pm and 6pm!

title: North Star 90
content:
North Star 90 is a 4-piece band formed over the past few years in Toronto’s east end, and they’ve been steadily creating a buzz with their surefire selection of ‘90s alt-rock/pop classics! The band members include Chris Scian (lead vocals/rhythm guitar), Jeff Filardo (lead guitar/vocals), Chris Bender (drums/vocals) and Dave McKoy (bass). Covering popular songs by iconic artists of the era (STP, Foo Fighters, Alice in Chains, Weezer, Tragically Hip, Blue Rodeo, etc.), as well as a few forgotten gems, they’ve been impressing crowds with their solid set-list! If you’re a fan of ‘90s music, you’ll be sure to enjoy this band’s great energy and groove!

Experience North Star 90 play alt-rock classics at the Midway Stage on August 19th from 8pm to 11pm!

title: Otis Gayle & The Icons
content:
Born in Kingston, Jamaica, Otis Gayle began his musical journey as a vocalist with The Virtues and later with Byron Lee and The Dragonaires. In 1968, he moved to Canada, where he established himself as a respected reggae artist. Gayle remains active in the music scene and recently released “Jah is The Answer,” a self-written and produced single inspired by colleague Carl Henry, aimed at uplifting the marginalized.

A major milestone in his career was winning a Juno Award in 1985 for Best Reggae Song with “Heaven Must Have Sent You.” Gayle has also released two solo albums: “Sweet & Sexy” in 1986 and “The Good Old Days” five years ago. With over 50 years in the industry, Otis Gayle continues to be a significant figure in reggae music.

Visit the talented Otis Gayle & The Icons on September 1 from 8pm to 11pm at the Beach Bar Stage!

 

Concerts free with admission. Buy Now!

title: Page Rutledge
content:
Paige Rutledge sparkles on stage, her vibrant personality and rhinestone-studded guitar make her a showstopper on stage. Her love for Country music began at an early age, Paige’s first live performance was for her loved ones at her grandfather’s funeral. It was at this moment that she learned how powerful music can be in connecting people from all walks of life. 2023, was her breakout year as she was selected as a finalist in Lucknow’s Music in the Fields Emerging Artist Showdown. She headlined at Youge and Dundas Square and opened for Walker Hayes at the Thunder Bay Country On The Bay summer festival. The emerging artist released singles “Gone Ain’t Really Gone” and “The Worst Thing” which are now in regular rotation on SirusXM’s Top of the Country Radio. She has received various editorial recognition including the cover of Amazon Music Breakthrough Country playlist, featurettes on several playlists including Spotify’s RADAR and Live Country. Paige is working on her debut EP, set to be released in late 2024.

Visit the Country Stage August 19th from 3pm to 6pm to hear the vibrant Paige Rutledge.

Pat Temple continues to tour, record, write and perform his own unique brand of toe tapping music. He has just completed his eighth album and is excited to share some new tunes with his fans across Canada. Pat loves to be out on tour, talking to people and gaining inspiration for his music. Having performed at many of Canada’s Music Festivals, he has become a mainstay in the Canadian scene. He has performed at Massey Hall, The National Art Gallery and the Ontario Place Forum. With over thirty years of performing experience, he has developed an impressive and unique body of work with songs like “Salamander Bones” and “Playin’ Havoc with My Heart”. Pat’s band at the Wine Garden will feature guitar wizard Kyle Tapscott, Jessie Whitely on keyboards and the invincible Rob Foreman on bass.

title: Paul James Band – Bob Dylan Tribute
content:
Paul James is a Juno and Maple Blues Award Winning artist praised for his contribution to blues music in Canada. The legendary Paul James Band will be honoring one of the greatest songwriters in history Bob Dylan, whom Paul has shared the stage with many times. The band will perform several of Dylan’s most loved songs from his earlier years, both electric and acoustic. Paul will also share some humorous stories from his experience playing and performing alongside Bob Dylan.

Please, join us at the CNE Midway Stage on August 16th from 3pm to 6pm as we celebrate the wonderful music of Bob Dylan with a man who has shared his stage, Toronto’s very own Paul James.

The Paul Langlois Band offers thoughtful rock and roll that’s both timely and timeless. The frontman, Paul Langlois is an iconic singer, songwriter, guitarist, and former member of The Tragically Hip. He is accompanied by bandmates Greg Ball on guitar and backing vocals, lead guitarist Joe Carscallen, Matt Mulvihill on bass, and drummer Billy Anglin. The band began an exciting musical journey when they were asked to play at the closing ceremonies for the Canadian Summer Games in Niagara Falls, and later debuted Pheromone Recordings. The Niagara Fall gig was an impetus for getting Paul Langlois to play music again and rekindling his interest in songwriting.

content:
Feel the passion Pearl Jamming brings to the stage; as they recreate the sonic-mastery of Pearl Jams’ studio albums – while capturing the energy, soul and creativity of their legendary live shows! title: Petty Nicks
content:
Canada’s Petty Nicks is a top-tier tribute show celebrating the music of Stevie Nicks and Tom Petty. The performance includes songs from Fleetwood Mac’s “Rumours,” Stevie Nicks’ solo career, and Tom Petty/Stevie Nicks duets. This show captures the essence and allure of these legendary artists in a stunning recreation of some of the world’s most beloved songs. Christina’s portrayal of Stevie Nicks is incredibly authentic, supported by seasoned industry professionals. Expect to hear hits like “Landslide,” “Leather and Lace,” “Stop Draggin’ My Heart Around,” “Free Fallin’,” and “Runnin’ Down a Dream,” along with some deeper cuts. Practically Petty’s Gerry Parsons delivers a spot-on Tom Petty. If you’re a fan of Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks, and Fleetwood Mac, this is a show you won’t want to miss!

Renowned for sold-out shows, Piece of My Heart highlights top-notch musicians hailing from the Greater Toronto area. Krista’s has earned her accolades and nominations in Florida and Las Vegas, recognizing her as one of the industry’s finest celebrity impressionists.​​

title: Pretty Archie
content:
Pretty Archie is an ensemble of long-time friends who started performing together in 2012. The band is comprised of Brian Cathcart (Lead Vocals, Guitar), Matt McNeil (Mandolin, Guitar), Colin Gillis (Harmonica, Bass, Vocals), Redmond MacDougall (Banjo, Percussion, Vocals) and Scott MacLean (Guitar, Mandolin). Since their 2013 debut album, Steel City, the band has built quite the reputation on the East Coast and across Canada. They are proud to represent the East Coast and carry a part of it with them on their travels. Their heartfelt lyrics are genuine and provide a deep connection with their listeners. Pretty Archie finds inspiration from genres like Country, Folk, Bluegrass and Americana. Their unique sound and energetic show captivate audiences time after time.

Raquel’s Riot is an electrifying cover band from the Greater Toronto Area. Mixing classic rock with modern pop from the ’60s to today, this high-energy band sets stages ablaze with their pulsating performances. Led by powerhouse vocalist Raquel, they captivate audiences with an exhilarating blend of musical styles that get everyone singing and dancing. Their magnetic stage presence and boundless enthusiasm create an immersive experience, uniting diverse audiences under the banner of music’s unifying power.

title: River Town Saints
content:
The River Town Saints are a dynamic country band who deliver energetic live shows and harmonic vocal performances. The name, River Town Saints, was inspired by the group of friends meeting at church and growing up in river towns around Ottawa. Over the years, the band has achieved significant success, including a top 10 hit with “Bonfire,” multiple Canadian Country Music Association (CCMA) nominations, and winning the 2017 CMAO Single of the Year for “Cherry Bomb.” They have toured with notable artists like Tim Hicks and Kip Moore and performed at major festivals such as the Calgary Stampede and Boots & Hearts.

Not only have they entertained large crowds, but they also raised over $50,000 for mental health and wellness during the pandemic. With millions of streams and several hit songs, including “Long Time Coming” and “What Ya Doin’ Tonight,” the band continues to make a significant impact on the country music scene. Their latest single, “Lying in Bed,” featuring New Zealand sensation Kaylee Bell is available on all streaming platforms.

title: Rob Fitzgerald
content:
Rob Fitzgerald, a Canadian country artist based in Nashville, combines diverse musical influences to create his unique Traditional/Neo Country style. His latest single, “Forever Together,” released on April 5th, features top musicians from Nashville and captures the sentiment of a marriage proposal. With chart-topping success in both Canada and the U.S., including multiple #1 spots on the Indie Country Countdown and appearances on the Music Row Country Charts, Fitzgerald has proven his musical prowess. His performances at prominent Nashville venues and appearances at Canadian festivals like Sunfest and Canadian Music Week solidify his status as an artist to watch in 2024.

title: Romulo Delgado – A Gypsy King’s Tribute
content:
Romulo Delgado is an operatic tenor, composer, world music vocalist, multi-instrumentalist, vocal coach and adjudicator. He was a region finalist at the Hans Gabor Belvedere International Opera competition in Vienna, Austria and trained in Toronto at the Royal Conservatory Music.

His versatility as a performer of classical and world music has enchanted audiences all over North America and Europe with his extraordinary ability to fuse different world music genres with exceptional musicality and talent.

In this show, Romulo Delgado pays tribute to the GYPSY KINGS, the world-famous band that influenced his early musical experiences. This tribute is a high-energy show that exposes audiences to the richness of Rumba Flamenco in a unique way as it fuses Latin American rhythms with authenticity and moving passion.

Join Romulo Degado – A Gypsy King’s Tribute on August 23 and August 30 between 8pm and 11pm for a high energy performance at the Beach Bar Stage!

title: Royal Tusk
content:
Royal Tusk is a Canadian rock band from Edmonton, Alberta that formed back in 2011. The trio includes Daniel Carriere on vocals, guitarist Quinn Cyrankiewicz, and Sandy Mackinnon on bass. Combining headbanging hooks, strong riffs and great lyrics, Royal Tusk’s music is incredibly catchy and has received tens of millions of streams and earned acclaim from Billboard, Loudwire, Consequence of Sound, Brave Words, and many others. The band released their third record “Altruistic” earlier this year. The catchy single “Head Up” has charted in the top 5 the Canadian active rock chart for months in a row.

Visit the Bell CNE Bandshell on August 28th to hear Royal Tusk rock out on stage!

title: Ruby Waters
content:
Her mellow manner is entirely disarming and comforting in the best way possible, Ruby Waters is a powerful artistic force set on a path that is wholly her own creation. Ruby’s music is an extension of her truest self—good times, good friends, and honest storytelling. Add in some nostalgic riffs, and cutting lyrics and you begin to see the picture clearly. As an independent artist, Ruby has amassed over 50 million streams, with her singles and two EPs, “Almost Naked” (2019) and “If It Comes Down To It” (2020), as well as a JUNO Award nomination for Alternative Artist of the Year in 2022. Touring is where Ruby thrives, having previously sold-out headline shows across the US, Canada, Europe and the UK. Looking ahead to 2024, Ruby Waters is captivating fans with her full-length debut, “What’s The Point”, and headline tours to follow, marking the beginning of an exciting new chapter.

Watch Ruby Waters perform her uplifting hit music at the Bell CNE Bandshell on August 27th.

title: Ryan Langdon
content:
Country singer Ryan Langdon, known for his party anthems like “Lit In The Sticks,” “Crossfaded,” and “Buck Wild,” now balances his career with being a dedicated father. Despite his new parental role, Langdon assures fans he remains the energetic performer they love. With over 8 million streams and four Top 40 Canadian Country radio hits, including “Leave Me Right” and “Country Like You,” he still finds joy in his daughter’s milestones. His recent hits, like “Feel Like Home,” a duet with Karli June, reflect his transition to family life. Collaborating with industry talents such as Dave Thompson and Patricia Conroy, Langdon exhibits versatility in his music. His upcoming releases will blend pop and hip-hop influences with his country roots, continuing to evolve his sound while staying true to his origins.

Visit the Country stage on August 16th from 8pm to 11pm to hear the talented Ryan Langdon’s music!

title: Saxy Grooves
content:
Bob DeAngelis is more commonly referred to as Canada’s own “King of Swing”. His musical talents have earned him world-class status as one of the globe’s finest jazz clarinetists. Bob is a multi-award-winning instrumentalist, with accolades spanning from winning two JUNO Awards, and “Jazz Clarinetist of the Year” from the Canadian National Jazz Awards. He has performed all over North America in numerous symphony orchestras and has entertained many heads of state, royalty and dignitaries. In 2008, Bob performed at Carnegie Hall with his own “Champagne Symphony Orchestra” celebrating the 70th Anniversary of Benny Goodman’s famous concert. He is considered one of Canada’s most popular bandleaders and even formed his own entertainment company DeAngelis Entertainment Inc., that provides quality music products to the commercial market.

Visit the Wine Garden August 26th and 27th from 2pm to 5pm to listen to the “King of Swing”, Bob DeAngelis.

title: Sloan
content:
Sloan, a Toronto-based rock band originally from Halifax, Nova Scotia, first began performing in spring 1991. The band comprises bassist and vocalist Chris Murphy, guitarist and vocalist Jay Ferguson, Patrick Pentland on guitar and vocals, and drummer and vocalist Andrew Scott. Sloan’s earliest album “Smeared” (1992) is rooted in alternative rock, while the tracks on their latest album “Steady” (2022) showcase a range of styles, from soft-rock melodies to upbeat, power pop. The band is credited as a main instigator of the Canadian East Coast alternative scene of the early ’90s. They have received nine Juno Award nominations and won for Best Alternative Album in 1997.

Visit the Bell CNE Bandshell on August 16th to hear Sloan rock out on stage!

title: SonReal
content:
SonReal is a Canadian singer, songwriter, rapper and visual artist with years of international touring, more than a dozen award nominations, 130 million video views and over 350 million global streams to his credit. Bursting onto the scene with the quirky, now-viral video sensation “Everywhere We Go” (36M views), SonReal and his team set a high bar for visual content and songwriting. The Double Platinum-certified single “Can I Get A Witness” was the first indication that SonReal had more to say as a songwriter and more to accomplish as an artist. His previous projects, “The Aaron LP” and “Nobody’s Happy All The Time”, are the culmination of this creative journey to align the artist persona of SonReal with the songwriter and person, Aaron Hoffman – every song is a deeply relatable look into the person behind the music. In support of this new body of work SonReal set out on his “Nobody’s Happy All The Time Tour” last year, covering over 30 cities across North America and garnered acclaim from Wonderland, NOTION, 1883 Magazine & more. This year, SonReal went completely independent and dropped a new mixtape “Pages” and kickstarted the rollout for his forthcoming album “All Things Aside” due for release August 2024.

Experience the Canadian rapper and songwriter SonReal perform his hit songs live on the Bell CNE Bandshell on August 25th!

The members have dedicated themselves to accurately reproducing the music and the spirit of an undying era, and the hard work has certainly paid off. Southern Fried is meant to be seen and heard. They are the type of band that provides you with a live experience of Southern Rock. Being hailed as simply the most authentic-sounding Lynyrd Skynyrd tribute anywhere doesn’t come as a surprise! The band has become a fan favorite at fairs and festivals across the country, pleasing audiences with hit after hit all night long!

title: Suzi Kory
content:
Suzi Kory is a country-rock artist from Toronto, Canada, whose musical career began in 2017 when she released her first EP “Spellcasting” with John-Angus MacDonald from The Trews. Since her debut she has recorded nine singles with producer Brent Woods. From these, five of her singles have been in regular rotation on Sirius XM, while two have reached the number-one spot on the Canadian Indie Country Countdown. Her musical talents have led her to perform at notable venues like The Whisky a Go Go in Los Angeles and Festival CoMA in Brazil. In 2020, Suzi Kory founded the Love Revolution Country Music Festival, which featured independent country music stars. In 2023, Kory was nominated for “Performance of the Year” at the Texas Sounds International Country Music Awards and won. Check out Suzi Kory’s official website here: www.suzikory.com

With Her viral chart-climber “I Don’t Need A Boy” (2.5 million streams) the reigning BCCMA Female Artist, Songwriter, and Interactive Artist of the Year continues to command attention. Garnering national media attention from the likes of eTalk, ET Canada, and CMT, millions streams and a staggering 48 million TikTok views, she stands tall as an independent artist. Her undeniable talent has put her writing rooms with industry veterans Chad Kroeger, Gordie Samson, Dylan Guthro, Emma Lee Doty, Baker Grissom, Phil Barton, Patricia Conroy, Karen Kosowski, David Thompson and Gavin Slate, and has seen her grace the stages of some of Canada’s largest summer festivals such as Boots & Hearts, LASSO, Cavendish Beach, and the Calgary Stampede.

title: The Band Caves
content:
The Band Caves is a dynamic Canadian country rock group who infuses their energizing sounds with deeply reflective lyrics. The band’s name pays homage to the concept of finding oneself in a metaphorical cave – a place of isolation, despair, and hopelessness. For the lead singer McCabe, these moments have served as an opportunity to remember that one is not alone. Their single “Before It’s Gone” is already a smash hit, incorporating new guitarist Jamie Ball, adding another layer to their music. They have shared the stage with country stars Jason Blaine and Nate Haller, solidifying their presence in the industry. Their music seamlessly blends country, rock and folk delivering a polished yet authentic sound. The Band Caves has achieved great success, reaching over 5 million streams on Spotify and a #1 song on the Indie Canadian Country countdown. The band is inspired by musical influences like Lifehouse, Matchbox 20, and the Goo Goo Dolls, which incorporate the deep appreciation for storytelling in music.

title: The Bullens
content:
The Bullen family is a talented musical group led by Eddie Bullen, a renowned jazz pianist and composer who moved to Canada from Grenada in 1980. With a career spanning over four decades, Eddie has become a key figure in Canadian jazz, winning awards and mentoring his sons. Tre-Michael Bullen, the youngest, is a skilled percussionist and drummer, adding dynamic rhythms to the family’s music. Belinda Brady, a two-time Juno nominee and Canadian Urban Music Award recipient, brings a soulful vocal presence to the ensemble. Together, the Bullen family offers a rich and harmonious musical experience that spans genres and generations.

title: The High Loves
content:
The High Loves are an indie rock band from Toronto, Canada’s creative capital. Formed in 2018, the four-piece group consists of lead singer and guitarist Noah Monckton, lead guitarist Marko Stojanovic, keyboardist Jeremy Ugro, and drummer Jaden Spanier.

Their music, coined Bubblegum Indie Rock, is the sonic equivalent of waking up in a good mood—a tight blend of danceable hooks, soaring vocals, healing guitars that squeal, and 80s-authentic synth, all knotted together in an addictive, unstoppable march. These songs are perfect for every summer: whether belting out on road trips, singing into a showerhead, or playing loudly when you just need to feel good.

His careers spans over a decade, emerging as promising talent in the industry, captivating audiences with heartfelt performances. He is influenced by both classic and contemporary country and roots music. Ty creates a unique sound that resonates with listeners by blending traditional and contemporary elements. He has had multiple successful releases and increasing radio play, he continues to be a driving force in the country music scene, as an up-and-coming star.

Visit the Country Stage August 26th from 3pm to 6pm to hear the vocal talents of Ty Wilson.

title: Unraveling the Wilburys
content:
“Unraveling The Wilburys” is an electrifying experience that unites seven of Toronto’s finest musicians in a tribute to the legendary Traveling Wilburys. The band channels the timeless magic of Tom Petty, Roy Orbison, George Harrison, Bob Dylan, and Jeff Lynne, bringing their iconic songs and unparalleled artistry back to life. Get ready to be swept off your feet as they deliver an unforgettable night brimming with soul-stirring melodies, face-melting guitar solos, and the kind of camaraderie that only true musical legends inspire.

Catch the legendary performance of Unraveling The Wilburys on August 27 from 9pm to 12am at the Midway Stage!

 

Concerts free with admission. Buy Now!

title: Voices of Classic Rock
content:
Step into the world of timeless rock with Voices of Classic Rock! It’s your chance to relive the unforgettable sounds that defined an era of freedom and rebellion. Led by the dynamic former ASIA lead vocalist John Payne, this extraordinary show features an incredible lineup of legendary rock artists. Join Jason Scheff, the longtime lead vocalist of Chicago, alongside Fran Cosmo, the former frontman of Boston, and Steve Augeri, renowned for his time as the lead vocalist of Journey. Together with John Payne, these iconic rock stars bring you hit after hit of beloved classic rock anthems. Experience the magic of live music and immerse yourself in the electrifying energy of Voices of Classic Rock, celebrating the enduring legacy of rock ‘n’ roll’s greatest hits.

Don’t miss the chance to rock out to the songs that defined generations with Voices of Classic Rock, at the Bell CNE Bandshell on September 1st!

Voices of Classic Rock will begin performing at 7:30pm. For performer set times, please check out our Instagram daily.

title: Wednesdays Engine
content:
Wednesday’s Engine is a five-piece pop, rock, and dance band with a unique sound and refreshing take on popular covers. Their musical repertoire encompasses songs from Luke Bryan, Nine Inch Nails and Ed Sheeran. They’ve performed at casino’s, clubs, fairs, and festivals across North America.

Visit the CNE Midway Stage to rock out with Wednesday’s Engine on August 21, 2024, from 8:00pm to 11:00pm at the CNE Midway Stage!

title: YASSiN & Sean Terrio
content:
Deeply emotional and highly fun, with great hair and love songs for days, YASSiN & Sean Terrio make genre-crossing music exemplified by soulful vocals and big song production.

Hailing from the town of Oakville, Ontario, the two met in 2019 while attending an open mic night at Oakville’s legendary Moonshine Cafe. They quickly discovered their musical and onstage chemistry, and immediately began writing songs together.

In 2020 they released their single Take My Time, which has amassed over 1 million streams across Spotify & YouTube. In 2021, their musical journey took another big step forward when they placed 2nd in Canada’s Walk of Fame Emerging Artist Program. Two years of performing across Canada, several singles later, plus their recent virality with their musical/comedy bits reaching over 20 million eyes, the duo is ready to release their debut album.

Visit the Beach Bar Stage on August 31 from 8pm to 11pm to experience the talented duo, YASSiN & Sean Terrio!
